item.title: War in Ukraine: The village with Russia and Belarus on its doorstep
item.description: Yogita Limaye visits a Ukrainian village on the border of Russia and Belarus that has been torn apart by war.

item.title: Musk buys Twitter: What's changing?
item.description: Questions have been raised over how the platform will change after being bought by the Tesla boss.

item.title: Alec Baldwin: Police release footage from set of Rust shooting
item.description: Authorities also released crime scene photos and interviews with witnesses, including Mr Baldwin's.

item.title: France election: Macron faces immediate challenges to power after victory
item.description: The re-elected French president has to focus on a new set of problems, beginning with a general election.

item.title: North Korea: Kim Jong-un vows to step up nuclear weapons programme
item.description: North Korea's leader spoke at a military parade which also saw banned missiles displayed.

item.title: Nato expansion: Finland and Sweden set to announce plans to join bloc
item.description: The US and UK will reportedly provide security support to the nations during the application process.

item.title: Donald Trump held in contempt in New York legal battle
item.description: The former president will be fined $10,000 (Â£7,850) every day until he turns over requested files.

item.title: Johnny Depp blames 'burn Amber' text on Monty Python
item.description: Mr Depp defends messages sent to fellow actor Paul Bettany saying he would burn his then-girlfriend.

item.title: Sex for Water in Kenya: What price are women and girls paying?
item.description: Women and girls are exposed to sexual violence as private vendors control the water supply in Kenya.

item.title: Bishop Evans: Body of guard found after he tried to save migrants
item.description: Bishop Evans jumped into the Rio Grande on the US-Mexico border when he saw two people in distress.

item.title: Osman Kavala: Turkish activist sentenced to life in prison
item.description: Osman Kavala is found guilty on coup plot charges in a case criticised as politically motivated.

item.title: How a Japanese boat trip ended in tragedy
item.description: A catalogue of errors appears to have led to the sinking of a boat carrying sightseers off northern Japan.

item.title: Viola Davis responds to critics of her Michelle Obama portrayal
item.description: The actress had been criticised by viewers for overly pursing her lips when playing Michelle Obama.

item.title: Ukraine: Facing the Russian Army on the front line in Donbas
item.description: Ukrainian forces have been holding the line in Donbas since 2014, but what was sporadic fighting has now turned into a full-blown war.

item.title: Australia election: Why is there compulsory voting?
item.description: It is one of the only English-speaking nations to have mandatory voting, and people widely support it.

item.title: How high-profile scientists felt tricked by group denying climate change
item.description: Politicians and scientists say they were duped by an organisation making false claims about global warming.

item.title: Will Taiwan's banks stay stuck in a '1980s' time warp?
item.description: How the pandemic may have jolted an old-fashioned banking industry to make changes.

item.title: Alec Baldwin shooting: New video shows actor rehearsing with gun
item.description: In new footage, the actor is seen rehearsing with a gun on set moments before Halyna Hutchins' fatal injury.

item.title: The Olympic hopeful turned bike-riding bank robber
item.description: When Tom Justice failed to make the Olympics he decided to use his cycling skills to rob banks instead.

item.title: Ethiopia's Lalibela struggles as war and Covid-19 keep tourists away
item.description: In the historic Ethiopian town of Lalibela, civil war and Covid-19 have left many without livelihoods.

item.title: France election: 'Many voted to build a barricade against the far-right', says Macron
item.description: After becoming the first French president re-elected in 20 years, Emmanuel Macron told supporters he was "the president of all."

item.title: Ukraine war: Celebrating Easter in the trenches outside Kyiv
item.description: Russian forces have moved away from Ukraine's capital, but those defending the city remain.
